Reviews.Title: “Great spot for easy access and a great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Randy L
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights with a rental car to see the sights of LA. Great location to all spots a tourist wants to see - the coast, Hollywood, Beverly Hills, etc. The rate of $100 was reasonable for the location and the room was clean and spacious. Front desk clerk was very friendly. The breakfast was the best we had all week in a trip that included many different hotels. You can also walk to Taco Bell or McDonalds.

Reviews.Title: “Not luxury but better than budget”
Reviews.Author: mtnbiker1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 16 nights. The staff at the desk was competent and helpful. No concierge though, but the desk staff can help. The lobby is just a step above a budget motel lobby. If you want luxury, go elsewhere. The hotel location is on the edge of sketchy. It's located about 1.5 miles east from the LAX terminal one, straight down Century Blvd. If you continue 1/2 mile further east you get into some less desirable spots for tourists (Inglewood). I walked several times 3/10 of a mile east of La Quinta to eat at Panda Express, Pollo Loco and to buy snacks at 7-Eleven. I had no problems, but the area under the overpass for the 405 freeway, that you have to walk through, is dark, dingy, and filthy. There is also a 24 hr. Subway across the street from the hotel and a Taco Bell a short walk to the west. The hotel has a reasonably priced menu in its restaurant, but I didn't eat there. I had a room with a King bed. The bed leaned to the hard side, but I slept comfortably on it. The bedspread was slightly worn with a hole in it, but the sheets were clean. The bathroom was tiny. The bathroom's open door was only about 6 inches from the toilet. Otherwise it was clean and the massage type shower head over the tub was good. Larger soap bars and conditioning shampoo were good. Towels were not thick and luxurious. They were not worn out but were thin and rough. A hairdryer is provided as well as a coffee maker. There was a nice (40" ?) LCD Samsung TV that had three ShowTime movie channels plus various other cable TV selections. I had a microwave and a small fridge in the room. Room temp was easy to control with the wall mounted digital thermostat. Sometimes they were late (after 4pm) getting fresh towels into the bathroom. the room was cleaned but they would bring the towels later. Sounds from the hall seemed to pass through the door as if there was no door there. I started wearing ear plugs to be able to sleep well. Many guests were very inconsiderate or at least unaware of how the noise they were making penetrated into the rooms even very late into the night. The guests are a little less refined than you see at the Hilton or Radisson I stayed at recently. Pets are apparently allowed in the rooms. There was no evidence that a pet had ever been in my room, but I saw many dogs with their owners in the hotel. One very large Mastiff and its owner accompanied me in the elevator one day. Three elevators in the 10 floor hotel that are sometimes very quick to move to your floor to pick you up and sometimes very slow. Push both buttons to get one to you sooner. A small corner couch, a footstool ottoman and a desk to work at which is part of the 6 drawer dresser in the room. The room was well lit with three lamps. There is a small pool on the 4th floor and an extremely small fitness room on the 2nd floor with two treadmills, a stationary bike and an elliptical I think. Thatâ€™s it. No hot tub in the hotel. There was free breakfast 6am to 9am which included mini muffins, coffee, scrambled eggs, pre-made waffles, orange, apple juice, water, white bread only to make toast, warm oatmeal (not instant) with raisins, brown sugar, and granola to add if desired, yogurt, bananas, apples and oranges and 3 types of dry cereal and 2% milk.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Place to Stay Near LAX for an Early Morning Flight”
Reviews.Author: kjd1978
Reviews.Content: I stayed here before an early morning flight back to the East Coast. I picked it based on the Trip Advisor reviews, the AAA 3 star rating, the price and the availability of parking. The parking garage is tight, of course, it is city parking. After we arrived we had to wait to check in due to an overly needy patron. This man thought the reception desk was a full scale concierge service. We got in line behind him while he was asking about local things to do........went to the rest room........came back......got in line behind somebody else in line behind him. And waited. But absolutely not because of the person at the check in desk.....this guy just wouldn't give up and apparently had no concern at all for the couple in back of him with a very young child. When we got to our checkin I was extremely impressed and happy with the speed with which we were checked in. A plus....the clerk noticed that we had gone to the restroom and immediately cut our parking fees by 50% as a result. Nice touch. I liked the fact that he noticed that we had asked the security guard where the restroom was. Details do count and I wish I had gotten his name. He also told us to take our time with our luggage from the temporary 20 minute parking and offered up security to help. There was a security person at the front desk at all times and we didn't take them up on the offer as we felt fairly secure going to our vehicle and back. We were very happy with the cleanliness of the room. We didn't experience any elevator delays and didn't try the stairs so I can't comment on that. I also cannot comment on the breakfast because I was checked out before that, but the coffee and fruit was most appreciated. If I travel through LAX again.....wouldn't definitely stay here for the same reason.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, OK airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: sailor908
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel simply for a place to sleep after a late flight, so we weren't too particular. The location was convenient, a 10 minute shuttle ride from LAX. The hotel was nothing special, and looked a bit tired, but it was clean, and the bed was comfortable. The staff were courteous, especially the morning crew. Breakfast, included, was better than I expected, with a selection of hot & cold cereals, eggs, toast, yogurt, fresh fruit. The elevators were slow, and all the stairways were blocked off for emergency use only. Inconvenient if you're only on the second floor, and would rather use the stairs. However, I'm guessing it's as good as any other airport hotel for the price, and would probably book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great service”
Reviews.Author: Scott535
Reviews.Content: First of all, I didn't expect too much coming here but was more than satisfied. Took the advice I found here and stayed on the side opposite from the main road and indeed had a nice, quiet clean room. Was in town for the Pac 12 basketball tournament with my girlfriend and it was a fair distance away from the Staples Center. Requested a razor and they brought up a nice packaged one, along with a small bottle of shaving cream and didn't get charged for it. People at the front desk were great. Breakfast was OK, about the only thing that held me back from giving this place a perfect review. Apple juice tasted like cider, the orange juice was bleh. I'm sure it's made from some sort of powder. On the bright side there was a wide variety of food; small muffins, cereal, eggs, waffles, oranges, bananas, yogurt. I do wish it went later than 9 in the morning and 10 on the weekend, but wasn't a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for park and fly”
Reviews.Author: Rienhart
Reviews.Content: Other than 3 of 4 elevators not working, we were happy with the service and rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I Chose Another Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lovegetzlaf
Reviews.Content: We needed to stay close to the airport and reading the reviews for this one, I was mislead. The hotel is rundown, smells, there were many dogs there and the area is unsafe and dismal. The bed was lumpy and the breakfast was non-tasting. Yogurt in plastic containers with no name and the coffee tasted like water. No problems with the shuttle. Next time I will spend more money so I don't fret about getting bitten by bugs.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a misconnection layover. Very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Geert M
Reviews.Content: It's an airport hotel, and it's a La Quinta. But given the crappy mood I was in after a misconnection at LAX, at 12am, after having traveled across the States, I guess the fact that I wasn't disappointed by the hotel should be a sign that it was actually pretty good. The staff at the reception desk was very friendly and the room was very decent and clean. At only 3 minutes away from the terminals it was all I needed for a couple of hours of sleep. On the front desk there was an Oscar for the best La Quinta renovation, which I think can be debated, but I definitely would have given the Oscar to the ladies at the front desk who got me out of my crappy mood in no time. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Business or Pleasure Visit”
Reviews.Author: hmk60
Reviews.Content: The La Quinta at LAX in Los Angeles is a great hotel to stay at when visiting LA for work or pleasure. The rooms are immaculate and the service personnel are extremely courteous, respectful and helpful with your every need. They literally make you feel like a VIP guest. The hotel also maintains an excellent restaurant, the Destination Restaurant, which is managed by Angel. Angel ensures that each guest is treated royally and the food is outstanding and reasonably priced. We never look beyond the La Quinta at LAX as a hotel to stay at when visiting the greater Los Angeles area. The hotel location is extremely convenient as it is only a few blocks from the Interstate 405 with easy access to most parts of the city. I highly recommend this hotel when visiting LA.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value & very friendly”
Reviews.Author: Chapmanberkshire
Reviews.Content: We used this as a base for a one night stay before catching an early morning flight to Texas. The hotel is a little tired but considering the price we felt that it was very good value for money. The beds were very comfortable and the room was clean and had good facilties. The only really annoying thing was the very old ice machine which was a good few doors away down the corridor but made the most horrendous noise (I checked out another floor and it was the same on the other floor - very noisy machine) and kept me awake through the constant droning. The staff were very friendly and we had to leave at 4.00am - there was coffee laid on as well as muffins & fresh fruit in reception which was very welcome (you wouldn't get that in a UK hotel!).

Reviews.Title: “Close to LAX, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Serina P
Reviews.Content: I stayed here before I left Los Angeles.Close to LAX, perfect for travellers. They have good shuttle service, easy to access to the airport. Rooms were clean and pretty big, staffs were friendly-especially one girl who helped me all my questions! (Unfortunately I cannot remember her name.) I liked their american style breakfast. It is near airport and it is not the prettiest downtown, but there is a place to eat around the hotel. it was just fine. I will definately go back there if I fly into Los Angeles again. I recommand this hotel if you look for a place to stay near LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Poor dinner service, many problems”
Reviews.Author: Cruisinstar
Reviews.Content: First the number written in the phone in my room had the wrong area code. Finally realized this after my family was trying to call me and couldn't get through. Then after a long day wanted to eat something in the restaurant in the hotel at 8 pm but they said it was closed....because of a employee party they were having. I got upset because there were no warnings to guests that it would be closed at 8 pm as they should be closing at 10 pm. Spoke to the manager you was trying to tell me to get good from their party, I mean really???? Finally she spike to the chef who made me something. On top of that the waitress was rude and simply said "were closed" without an explanation.

Reviews.Title: “Last minute surprise!”
Reviews.Author: amanda c
Reviews.Content: I had had enough of Motel 6, but was looking for yet another near the LAX airport. Lo and behold I found a minor miracle at La Quinta. The price was a bit more than Motel 6, but I needed to see some art and happy people walking around. The garage elevator was out of service so the fee for parking was waived. The security guy helped me with my bags, dog and bike and with a smile. The service at the desk was quick and helpful. My room is happy, comfortable, clean, inviting and quiet. There are many people here at the hotel and it is very quiet!! Very modern amenities and art!! 5 pillows on a King bed. Everything looks new and minimalist!! This is refreshing...Thanks La Quinta!

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for....”
Reviews.Author: carenb_MA
Reviews.Content: If you just need a quick stop close to the airport, this is OK, but this hotel feels old and run down. We had a room on the 10th floor, and could still hear road noise all night. Could also hear the people in the room next door. The elevator to the parking garage was broken, and had to walk down the stairs. The elevators inside the hotel were very slow to arrive. Breakfast is included, but there is not much to speak of, some eggs and pre-made waffles. But, this is incredibly convenient to the airport, and we saw many people making use of the free airport shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: CMDW
Reviews.Content: Clean, quiet, generous breakfast, pleasant staff. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Koda
Reviews.Content: I recently moved after living in LA for 15 years and was back in town on business and needed a reasonably priced room near LAX. This hotel fit the bill. It is recently renovated and very clean. The style in the rooms is kind of retro and there are flat screen tvs, a nice bathroom, a good sized closet. Beds are comfortable and the free breakfast includes everything from eggs, waffles, and oatmeal to yogurt and fruit. Management is eager to please - even sent me a follow-up email. The only downside is that the rooms are a little small.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for LAX”
Reviews.Author: prism1
Reviews.Content: Most LAX area hotels share shuttles with other hotels but the free service was fine. The room was comfortable and clean, I like the new TVs. The free in room WiFi worked fine. Breakfast buffet was adequate. There's fast food choices nearby. Check in was friendly and the price includes services that are extra at other hotels in the area. Overall a very good choice for an overnight stay by the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good option close to LAX”
Reviews.Author: nopar65
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night after a long flight. The hotel is really close to LAX in an uneventful street with other hotels. There is a diner with internet across the street. The room was good and quiet. Service is a bit distant but they get their job done. The website is not clear about transportation from the airport. This hotel shares the shuttle with the Holiday Inn next door. I had to call the hotel to find out about the shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Giving it a solid A.”
Reviews.Author: e_marty
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in LA; my wife and I were there for a convention at the Westin near the airport. Instead of staying at the Westin, we stayed across the road at La Quinta. It is adjacent to Holiday Inn and essentially shares the yard with it. Check-in took seconds; the clerk named Frankie was very friendly and professional at the same time. We asked for a quiet room and Frankie gave us one facing away from the road, on a higher floor. Fantastic choice! We could the the scenic mountains in the morning. The room was fairly basic, but clean and bright. Finally, this hotel figured out room lighting so you can actually see at night ! In-room fridge and microwave, coffeemaker with a stainless steel pot, iron and ironing board, free WiFi that reaches across the road and an LCD TV - all great things to have when you are away. I would call the decor Spanish colonial, with a lot of orange, warm yellow and white, with blue accents, as you would often see in tropical places. The furniture was clean and sturdy, no complaints at all. The bed was soft and comfortable; the headboard was like a large addition to the wall above, which was nice. The only surprise was feather-filled pillows, but they also had synthetic pillows. I guess every taste could be satisfied. We noticed a security representative in the lobby at all times, it was reassuring. Breakfast was nothing to write home about: scrambled eggs, toast, Belgian waffles (you don't get to make your own), muffins, yogurt, fruits and a few other little goodies. We did not encounter any meat items for breakfast over two days. Breakfast is served starting at 6 am. One more odd thing: Orange Juice had an unnatural taste to it. I gather it was reconstituted from powder. Very disappointing for a hotel in California! The first night, we grabbed a bite at the hotel restaurant. Two bowls of veggie soup and a bowl of sliced fruit came up to $19 after taxes. Call me strange, but I think it's a lot, so we never went back for lunch or dinner. Speaking of eating out, there aren't a lot of places to eat nearby. There is a Subway and an Internet cafe/restaurant across the road (both get very busy during lunch when there is a convention at Westin); Taco Bell and Macdonald's. People say, there is a Chinese restaurant on the other side of the highway, but we haven't walked there. There are about 20 car rental places in the three buildings surrounding La Quinta, and there is one downstairs in this building, but we did not rent a car this time. Check-out was a breeze, too. They have a designated computer for those wishing to check-in to their flights and to print out boarding passes. We asked to leave our luggage until later in the day, and got the luggage stored for free in a storage room. A shuttle bus runs from La Quinta/Holiday Inn to the airport and back, and you do have to have a hotel bill to get on the bus at the hotel. At the airport, they pick you up in designated spots on the Arrivals level.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Chrissc64
Reviews.Content: Room was nice and very clean, breakfast was modest, but very good. Staff very respectful and cordial. We stay here every time we visit Los Angeles. Excellent shuttle service to and from airport. A wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay near the airport.”
Reviews.Author: RespectIsEarned
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night...arrived late and left early...room was clean..bed was comfortable...shuttle service was on time and kept me on schedule. I would most definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I would look at other accomodations around LAX....”
Reviews.Author: Canuck_Wine_Guy
Reviews.Content: We had to stay here due to a forced lay over on flights. We checked in at 9:30, no one took the trouble to tell us kitchen closed at 10 pm, so our dinner food vouchers were of no use. Breakfast the next day was minimal served on styrofoam plates, plastic cutlery, wow I don't object to cutting corners but that beat all I have seen. We asked for non-smoking but you could clearly smell the stale cigarettes in the room, carpets in the halls were all stained as well as the room, the place all around looks very beaten up. If the next hotel is $10 or $20 more per night, spend the money....it will be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “La Quinta Inn & Suites LAX”
Reviews.Author: thairadio
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a number of times, since 2008 with my wife and my elderly mother and have only had one issue in all of the stays. And that had to do with a collect phone call made from a pay phone in the lobby, my advice, DON"T, The rooms are clean, well appointed, quiet, meet my needs to a tee.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: smsiska4
Reviews.Content: Our 3 night stay at this hotel was very comfortable and welcome. Parking is $15/day but it is covered and out of the sun/elements. The rooms are standard motel/hotel size, with VERY SMALL, albeit clean, bathrooms and vanity areas. Rooms are very clean and have up to date decor, including a 32" flat screen TV with cable and a built in TV guide. Free wifi is pretty slow, but useable. The breakfast is outstanding, complete with eggs, pancakes, waffles, toast, and all other normal continental breakfast items. The pool is heated and is best to be used at night when the temp dips below 60. My only complaint here is with the elevators. being a 10 story hotel, most people need an elevator to get to their room, but they only have 2 are they are VERY SLOW. Also, you need to make a u-turn on the road to get on the highway, but other than those, i would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Love La Quinta!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Angela B
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay, close to all the beaches, great breakfast & the best thing of all......PET FRIENDLY!! Our puppy loved the hotel just as much as we did! We've always had great stays at all the La Quinta hotels we've stayed at throughout the years. Great customer service!! THANK YOU!!! We will be back. Christian, Angela & Dorado

Reviews.Title: “Close to LAX but no too close.”
Reviews.Author: Blair M
Reviews.Content: Great location but not to close to get the aircraft noise. Check in was quick and friendly and the rooms were well quipped with a fridge and microwave. Breakfast was well stocked with a large selection. There is a McDonalds on one side, a Pizza hut and Taco Bell on the other and Subway across the road. The shuttle to the airport came exactly when they said it would. **visited March 2010**

Reviews.Title: “excellent customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Sade P
Reviews.Content: we recently travelled 20hhrs from new zealand to l.a. i chose this hotel because it was close to the airport and the website looked great! when we arived we were taken great care of by the staff (Frankie and Alex), who welcomed us and got us into our room in great time. We were informed of transport options close by, and things to eat, see and do. When i enquired of how to get to disneyland, Frankie imediatley explained the pro's and cons of all the availible options and helped us choose the best one (a tour with VIP tours). Upon our return late at night, we were greeted with a warm welcome by the night staff. I enquired about heading out the next day to go shopping, and again all the options were explained to us. Diedra was extremly helpful, and went over and above to ensure we were safely taken out and guided around the streets of downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: Lethalcjr
Reviews.Content: The service was awesome! The staff was friendly and helpful. It was so late when i checked in. I did not have a reservation, but I was accommodated. The room was fine, but there were old soda cans and a used bar of soap left in the room. It could have perfect if not for those small gross things. I was way too tired to complain. I'm sure it was just overlooked and you would have all 5 from me otherwise. Again awesome service! I would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No front door loading and unloading”
Reviews.Author: jolinpl
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the proximity to LAX which was 5-10 min away. We had two double rooms facing the road on the ninth floor and we could hear the traffic and even the planes. The beds were adequately hard , heating was good , shower , bath tub , coffee maker all adequate. Only complaint: there was no unloading or loading at the front door. One has to park the car complimentary for 20min in the car park, walk down to the hotel , check in which was reasonably efficient , then head back with the trolley to load the luggage and then push it back into the hotel. We definitely took longer than the 20 min . To be fair , the counter staff did validate the parking. There is a Denny's and Macdonald's nearby as well as a Subway opposite the hoyel. Rental cars (we booked Thrifty) are a easy 5 minute walk away. We will stay in this hotel again but only if we did not have to handle so much luggage. We will also request for a room facing away from the road the next time.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: rgajd3
Reviews.Content: The location is the best for LAX for a value hotel. Breakfast was excellent. Only problem was the elevators were down for the entire time. I took about 10 minutes for an elevator to check in and check out.

Reviews.Title: “Free Shuttle to LAX”
Reviews.Author: CasualView
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the night before leaving on an international flight. The hotel itself is somewhat old, but it is clean and certainly adequate for a good night's rest before going through the headaches faced these days by anybody opting for air travel. The breakfast was average, about what one would expect for the very reasonable cost of the room. The very good shuttle system that is shared with the Holiday Inn next door is the outstanding feature of this hotel. It runs 24 hours a day and is as fast as can be expected for the heavily congestion that surrounds LAX. We will definitely stay here again before our next Asian trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Lauralovestoexplore
Reviews.Content: We didn't realise how far it was from main LA and taxi's would have been a nightmare however they organised a town car to take us everywhere and fetch us when ever we wanted! We felt like stars if that doesn't sound too cheesy, ha! We only stayed 4 days but everyone was lovely and very helpful. We spent the days sight seeing and investigating LA and we always dined at the restaurant at the hotel as 'outside' can be abit scary at night apparently, the food was lovely. The only bad experiences we encountered is that everyone in LA asks for money all the time! Which becomes very annoying. I would recommend this hotel to everyone though!

Reviews.Title: “will pick a different hotel next time i head to LAX”
Reviews.Author: KLD1970
Reviews.Content: negs: loud (right next to main road to LAX); step outside lobby and it's not a great part of town; one elevator for parking, then another for the hotel (inconvenient and slow); pool is not laid out well. pos: close to LAX; rooms were pretty clean and neat; price (with AAA discount)

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: teresa s
Reviews.Content: i'm really a huge fan of la quinta inn and have not yet been disappointed with any of their locations. the only problem we almost had with this hotel was that our first day there two of their three elevators weren't working, causing a long wait for the one elevator remaining (even more of a problem when you're on the eighth floor with a two year old!). when we complained downstairs, the front desk informed us that they knew about it and were working on it, and it was fixed by the time we got back from dinner! any place can have problems, i was impressed with how quickly they took care of theirs. other than that, the room was beautiful, clean and had great amenities (fridge and microwave... AND they gave us a crib for the kiddo). i'd definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “good layover spot”
Reviews.Author: PencilsPoints
Reviews.Content: no complaints....breakfast was much better than we had expected, and this motel is within 2 blocks walking of good restaurants. a bit noisy most of the night and this is probably caused by the early departures out of LAX and guess all the nearby motels have the same noise problem, otherwise, i would not recommend only because of the noise factor and the automatic closure of the heavy doors that slam shut. shuttles seem to run every 5-10 min to LAX so overall. recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you!”
Reviews.Author: Marilou C
Reviews.Content: The 1st National Assembly of Roman Catholic Filipino Priests (serving the church of the USA) was held at the Westin LAX Hotel (Nov 8 - 11, 2011). With early reservation some of my fellow volunteers were able to get a room at the Westin. With the 372 priests that attended the event, 30 of the priests (hotel's oveflow) were booked at the Four Point hotel. I was offered to stay at the Four Point but I chosed to check-in at the La Quinta since it's just a walking distance to Westin. I stayed Tue night (11/8/11), then came back with my husband on Thurs night (11/10/11). Tue night at 10:30 my toilet bowl was clogged and I called the registration desk. In 3-4 minutes the maintance guy was knocking at my door. What a great service! I would like to commend Frankie & Alex at the registration desk for a great service we received from them. Very friendly, respectful and accomodating. Tue, when I had my parking ticket validated, Frankie greeted me by my first name with a friendly, very professional way " Hi Marilou, what can I do for you "? With him was Alex, who also greeted me with a smile. In my mind, I said, this is the kind of employees every place should have. Thurs, when Frankie saw me again he said " Welcome back Marilou". My husband met both Frankie & Alex. Comment from my husband.... 2 great guys/employees. "THANK YOU FRANKIE & ALEX " for a great experience we had at the La Quinta Hotel and thank you to whoever hired these two guys. Great choice. Question: Is it okay with La Quinta Management if we invite Frankie & Alex out for lunch? Marilou Cruz

Reviews.Title: “Overall solid Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: dean s
Reviews.Content: While traveling too much for my liking, I stay at many places, under all kinds of conditions. There was no single outstanding aspect of my stay here. However....everything very good indeed, from bed comfort, to staff attitude this location was a winner!! My wife had left her purse on a chair after the nice, basic, breakfast, and we returned to find a staff member had it locked away in a cabinet waiting for her to identify & claim. There was no weaknesses in this location at all. I will seek this place when staying anywhere in the area. Thank You

Reviews.Title: “Airport Proximity”
Reviews.Author: lssrinivas
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this property as a part of our Transit LA visit and this hotel is OK comfortable and conveniently situated cto LA Airport. Taco Bell is close by and the room has mini conveniences like Microwave and Refrigerator.A small convenience store is on premise operating from 5 am to 11 pm Its ok value for money but if i could get a Crown Plaza or Hilton even a wee bit expensive i would choose it!!!

Reviews.Title: “"A wonderful bargain gem in a very expensive city"”
Reviews.Author: Louise S
Reviews.Content: Decided to find a hotel near LAX to avoid driving in morning rush hour traffic. Since I always use Tripadvisor as my guide, I took the advice of others and tried LaQuinta at LAX and my husband and I were delighted with this hotel. From the first greeting until the last goodbye at checkout, the staff was very pleasant, helpful and courteous. The breakfast was good, hot & plentiful. There were many choices. The room was very large and with many amenities you would not expect from a "budget priced" hotel - like free internet. The shuttle was very quick to arrive at the airport and ran every 15 minutes around the clock. We would absolutely return here on our next visit to LAX area.

Reviews.Title: “October 17-21,2011”
Reviews.Author: Debbie B
Reviews.Content: This property is a real jewel. Comfortable, friendly, good restuarant, free breakfast (not just continental), free wi-fi. While our conference was hosted at another hotel we came out way ahead by staying at the La Quinta.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value with a nice breakfast”
Reviews.Author: TravelingVillager
Reviews.Content: It was so nice being picked up by the Shuttle at LAX, The thoughtful driver brought my bags in. I was only staying one day so it was great to have lunch and dinner in the hotel. My room was clean nice looking and comfortable. My breakfast is usually cereal, banana, a second fruit, orange juice, muffin and coffee. I had all of this plus bacon. The little muffins were very good & I saved my apple for later. Staff were very nice. This was great for a one night layover. I was well rested and the Shuttle drop was right in front of my plane location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for LAX airport”
Reviews.Author: siteg
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located, just outside LA airport and right across from car rental companies. The rooms are 5-star both in size and quality with brandnew furnishing and appliances. Yet, the lobby area and cafeteria would get 3-star at best. Complimentary breakfast is really basic; scrambled eggs only that comes with plastic plates and forks! Last but not least, parking is extra at around $15 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Great proximity to airport!”
Reviews.Author: Wayako
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our one night stay at this hotel - great breakfast, comfortable room, convenient parking, nicely decorated and appointed. Would have preferred queen instead of full-sized beds, but other than that, very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amanda41579
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Clean rooms, compfy beds, friendly staff. They do charge a fee for parking in their parking garage (which is your only option). You have to have your parking voucher validated everytime you leave which is kinda of a pain but the staff was quick and never gave me a problem. There is a McDonalds right next door that we walked to for breakfast. Overall it was a good experience and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and clean”
Reviews.Author: platinum60
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at this hotel and found the staff accommodating and friendly. The room was clean and well stocked, the beds comfortable. I DO wish the bathroom was larger though, it was a little cramped for two women. I have never been displeased with any of my stayes at a LaQuinta Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mccluskeyk2
Reviews.Content: I recently had a 3 night stay at the LAX La Quinta. I found the hotel to be clean and nicely renovated. The free breakfast was simple but very good. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better but not bad”
Reviews.Author: halinda
Reviews.Content: Needed an overnight stay by LAX. The hotel was near and offered shuttle to the airport. If you have a car, there is a high fee for parking at the hotel. The rooms were clean & modern, the hotel was completely sealed as you could not open the windows for any fresh air. All air flow came from a noisy conditioner on the wall under the window. One of the few La Quinta's that offers a restaurant on the premises with alcoholic beverages.

Reviews.Title: “THIS HOTEL STINKS. LITERALLY.”
Reviews.Author: Jilie D
Reviews.Content: Dont waster your moeny here! Our room had a terrible odor, the furniture was dirty and we did not appreciate the person running on the tredmill above our bed starting at 5AM.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely Renovated Hotel with Friendly Accommodating Staff”
Reviews.Author: TimeTraveller2011
Reviews.Content: This past year and last, I have made 4 trips to LAX and every time, I have stayed at the La Quinta Inn & Suites LAX. This hotel is newly renovated with a 70's look. Very chic! The rooms are small, but very clean. We had a king size deluxe with fridge & microwave which was perfect as each time, we had a week's stay for a conference at the Westin (right across the street) and were able to go back to our room and make our own lunch. The staff are amazingly friendly and extremely accommodating as I required non-feather pillows which they sent up to my room OR had the pillows already in the room when we checked in (since we had stayed there a few times the staff had a note on our file). Every staff member from the check-in, room attendants, restaurant staff, and security where extremely friendly and helpful with all questions. There is a free hotel shuttle from LAX to the front door of the hotel, & there is a trolley stop as well out front which runs to Manhattan Beach and stops at two large shopping centers, each with a grocery store. Also, there is a great hot buffet breakfast included with your room. I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel to anyone who is looking for an inexpensive, clean, friendly and safe hotel near LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but scarey”
Reviews.Author: flameon70
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convenient for LAX with a shuttle stopping here but we were shocked to find Hotel security in our room "just checking Sir" and maintaining a presence at breakfast in the dining room. The continental eat all was certainly filling but it wasn't really a continental breakfast. Plenty of doughnuts, pancakes, scrambled eggs but it would have been nice to have toast and fresh fruit. Everyone very pleasant but this hotel is what it is- a little downmarket and nowhere near LA . you'll have to hire a car - DO NOT GO public transport unless you want to be accosted by every beggar in LA and threatened on trains; with one person boasting I only got out of the Pen 3 days ago...Nice!

Reviews.Title: “Good for families”
Reviews.Author: passiflorabear
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems to attract mainly families with lots of young children, which frankly didn't appeal to us as a young couple. Although we never had to wait for an elevator, the elevators got very crowded quickly, unlike most other hotels we've stayed at. Our room was quiet enough. Breakfast was filling (eggs, potato, cereal, etc.) and looked like the Costco food court, lots of guests chowing down as much as they can. I didn't appreciate having to pay for parking in their enclosed lot. Also, the lobby seemed to be full of smoke despite it being illegal in California to smoke in/near the entrances since 1995. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to friends, but the breakfast is definitely a good value for families.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting stay”
Reviews.Author: HappyFam5
Reviews.Content: We are LQ Returns members, and have stayed at many LQs in our time. We find the chain to be mostly good. Honestly, though, most locations are older and have seen far better days. This property kinda is at the top of the old and run-down list. Got to parking structure fine, and went to front desk. I must say, the employees are very nice and professional. I really liked the experience interacting with them. Since this was a week night and we knew they were not fully booked, we asked for an upgrade to a nicer room, which they cheerfully gave. Mind you, it was my wife and I, plus our 4 year-old son. We originally had a King bed....After we got to our upgraded room, we found that we had a room with a full bed and a sleeper-sofa. At this point we were so tired that we did not get a different room, but it was definitely an over-site to put a family of 3 into that upgraded room with such a small bed. A/C was not working properly, room was kinda run down.....In the morning, it was a nightmare to find an elevator down to the lobby. These things are so tiny and always seemed to be full. We finally made it outside to wait for the shuttle to LAX. 1st, don't believe the every 15-20 minutes that is advertised...It was a lot longer than that. Additionally, it was gross waiting for the shuttle van for 2 main reasons. 1st, this hotel is in a really old and run-down part of town. Not the safest or best neighborhood at all. 2nd, the shuttle stop is located EXACTLY at the same spot as the smoking area. Trust me when I say that a VERY large number of Europeans use this facility, and ALL of them seem to puff away non-stop, which is kinda gross. We had to retreat at one point inside the lobby because it got so bad. Unfortunately, it got worse at that point. The other main lobby door that leads to the parking structure was blocked open, and another group of smokers was out there, so a stiff breeze was blowing in that door and it was filled with cigaret smoke. It was just too much for us...Would not stay here again just for that fact. Only 2 exit doors from property and so there is no choice but to walk through a thick cloud of smoke to get somewhere... We did the Stay&Park deal, and when we came back several days later to get our car we had to interact with front desk staff again, and once again they were as nice and professional as can be. I really enjoyed how good they were towards their guests...For guest service I would give this property 5 stars, but with being an old and run-down property, plus the smoking issues, my overall rating is 3 stars..Oh, shuttle van drivers were great. They know their way around and that was a great convenience for us...They loaded our bags into van and we tipped a few bucks, which they seemed to appreciate!

Reviews.Title: “OK for an overnight stay but no longer”
Reviews.Author: DisneyOrBust1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was reasonably clean but definitely a 2.5* hotel. We settled for La Quinta for an overnight layover because of slim pickings from conferences held in LA that weekend. We paid way too much $$ for the nights' stay. There was nothing special and acceptable for an overnight stay. I would not stay longer though as there are better hotel choices. Breakfast was sub-par. Low quality continental fair with cereals, oatmeal, greasy week-old muffins, (stale) toast, scarmbled eggs and soggy hashbrowns. Don't expect too much or you'll be disappointed. Ratings are based on a 2.5* hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Noisy!!”
Reviews.Author: master815k
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night with my family. Woke up around 4am to the noise of the traffic. Our room was on the 7th floor and faced Century Blvd. If you are going to stay there ask for a room that faces the alley instead. Other than that, the hotel was decent. Nice breakfast and the kids loved swimming in the rooftop pool. Was going to stay there on our trip back in two weeks, but decided to change it to the embassy suites down the street.

Reviews.Title: “helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Christina J
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Lax La Quinta. It was easy to park, and conveniently located. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the rooms were clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good stop over hotel”
Reviews.Author: portmagpie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in transit for one night and found this hotel very good value, clean and comfortable good service with a good breakfast selection included. It will be our choice for our future LAX stop overs

Reviews.Title: “OK but probably won't stay again”
Reviews.Author: the2robbiesAdelaide
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 separate occasions in July. This is a real 70's style hotel with light timber furniture and orange chair covers. In the bathroom the chrome had just about been polished off the taps however the room was clean and well presented. First stay was placed in back of building well away from the noise of West Century Blvd. Second stay was front of building - lots of noise from passing traffic, especially early morning. Both times I arrived early and told no rooms available and to come back later. I expected this but the 2nd time the clerk let me know in no uncertain terms that check-in was 3pm! He didn't even look at me as he said it! I felt that basically he was saying "Get out of here - don't want to know you". Positive thing about stay was free WIFI which worked well. Also plenty of nearby takeaway to choose from. Didn't take advantage of continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: janefteach
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight 7/25, on my way home from China. Courteous service desk and nice room with comfortable bed. Good value for the price. Full breakfast was a plus. Appreciated the free shuttle service. Definitely recommend! Only downer was the crowded elevator service.

Reviews.Title: “Right choice for LA - once again”
Reviews.Author: adeges
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel again in October 2010, twice actually - on the way to LA and from LA, couple of nights each time. This time I stayed with my wife and my son. We stayed in a bigger room with 2 double beds on 9th floor. Bigger rooms are facing W. Century Blvd and no kitchen A/C noise is heard there. Overall, same good impressions as my first time there (see my earlier review), no sunrise in the window though :) Breakfast was better than in January 2010 as no strange taste of the omelet. Standard La Quinta menu: omelet, supermarket bagels and muffins, cream-cheese, orange juice and coffee. Fries on Sundays. Pretty poor selection and average quality but enough to get your engine going until lunch. In addition, what other breakfast would you expect from 72 dollars a night for 3 people in Los Angeles in order for the hotel to break-even? Remember, free street parking just off La Cienega Blvd is a 5 min walk away! Very few other hotels near LAX could claim the same precious (like 12 bucks a night) benefit :) As I arrived LAX late night, taking a free bus to the hotel was a much better option than going immediately to the car rentals with a family and the luggage. In the morning I went back to the terminals and took a free car-rentals bus to Avis (or Hertz last time) there. Not unique convenience compared with other LAX hotels, obviously. As someone below mentioned the elevators recently, it looks like their work has not improved much since October 2010: I had to use stairs a couple of times back then, especially in the mornings. Windows cannot be open - good only if weather allows you to avoid using in-room A/C which is very very noisy. I was lucky both times (January and October) so cannot really complain here.

Reviews.Title: “Was a last resort due to 405 closure and we will not return!”
Reviews.Author: Laterisers
Reviews.Content: We did not know about the highway 405 closure prior to arriving in LA. For the last night decided to move closer to the airport, when we called around there was only one room left and it was here. It was far from my first choice, but was all that was available and we will not return. When we arrived there was a tour bus unloading in front of us (poor timing by us, not the hotels fault) but still did not help the overall opinion. Parking garage was very full and had to park on the top floor, elevator to the lobby might be the smallest elevator I have ever rode in and there was only the one. When we got to our room, I thought it was very dated and unappealing looking, the air conditioner was very loud and with this being the last room available, no choice for us to be moved. my wife had to use ear plugs to sleep, I did not have any so got very little sleep. On top of that, due to the highway closure, we were charged over $200 for a room that I do not think was worth $50. La Quinta, you got me, but it will be the last time. If this is typical of the properties I will not stay at another!

Reviews.Title: “Clean!”
Reviews.Author: Melodyjo
Reviews.Content: I read reviews for hotels around LAX and could not find a hotel I would want my 2 year old and family to sleep in. When I came across the reviews for the La Quinta Inn LAX, most said clean so we decided to give it a try. The staff was helpful and nice, the room was up dated and clean and house keeping had the crib in the room before we arrived. It was a great place to stay for a early flight out of LAX. One problem; the shuttle was not timely, we waited from 6:45am until 7:20 and it still had not arrived. We ended up driving to the airport. Hopefully that's not the norm.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: Liteh
Reviews.Content: Spent a few hours overnight prior to an early-morning departure at LAX. Not one of my favorite hotels in the LAX area, but adequate for one night. Lobby and elevator are pretty depressing. Fortunately, the room was nicer than the lobby's appearance had suggested might be the case. Paid $77 plus taxes for two beds. Considering the cost of the room, parking is expensive at about $15 plus tax. Parked on the street across from the hotel for free -- but this only worked because the flight was departing before the daytime street parking fees kicked in. Not worth more than about $85 or $90 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: marivi90804
Reviews.Content: I was scheduled to leave LAX very early in the morning for a business trip to the East Coast. Rather than trying to get to the airport from home, I decided to spend the night at La Quinta Inn and Suites. When I mentioned at check-in that I was on an early morning flight, the person at the reception desk immediately offered a wake-up call at 4:00 AM (yes, that's how early I had to get up!). I've traveled extensively and have never been offered a wake up call unless i asked for it. My room was adequate, clean, though a bit small. A 24/7 shuttle to LAX is available for free. The only complaint, and it had nothing to do with the hotel, was with the shuttle. I was down in the lobby by 4:25 AM to catch the 4:30 shuttle. By the way, the hotel offers coffee and muffins in the lobby for folks leaving early in the morning. Thank you, La Quinta! The shuttle never arrived at 4:30. It was closer to 5:00 before it pulled in. However, the front desk was very attentive and gave updates on the shuttle's status. Luckily, LAX is just a five minute drive from La Quinta or I really would have been upset. Overall, I highly recommend La Quinta Inn and Suites, especially if you need to get to the airport very early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!!!”
Reviews.Author: mariahzwind
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights after a long flight from Sydney, before heading to our final destination. This is a really great airport hotel like someone else reviewed. It was clean and very comfortable and stylish! Breakfast was the way La Quinta breakfasts are supposed to be. With lots of variety! As a LQ Returns member it was lovely to have been already checked in, it was so easy after such a long haul! Mc Donalds is a short walk down the block, there's a Subway across the street and there may be a few other fast food places up the street. If I am ever in LA again and need to be close to the Airport this will be the place we stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Airport Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: marilynjoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 different times during our 5 week trip to America! We found the check in staff very helpful, we landed early on a Sunday morning, after a 14 hour flight. Check in is not until 3 Pm , but they sent us to have breakfast, and found a quiet room for us by 11AM. Our other 2 stays were great too, by the time we came back for our last overnight stay, Frankie, at check in remembered us, once again we were early but this time a room was ready straight away. The rooms were all clean and comfortable, the free WiFi excellent, and even though very close to Lax, we were never bothered by plane noise! They have a free shuttle to and from the terminals and the drivers are very helpful with the luggage. We also hopped on the Red Bus to Manhatten Beach for last minute shopping, $5 for all day! This hotel is not 5 stars, but you don't pay a five star price, for the price I think it is a excellent choice for an overnight airport stay, we hope to come back one day, thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Pet friendly and rooms stink, slow service in restaurant and slow elevators”
Reviews.Author: Archie1005
Reviews.Content: It is a mediocre hotel and the closet stunk. My room was one of the top floors, elevators take time to reach there, the restaurant service is slow, and there is no nearby restaurant/shopping area--this is in middle of nowhere despite being minutes from LAX. Most folks in the shuttle (common shared shuttle from airport) were going to Westin but I am sure it must be pricier--I was the only person getting off at La Quinta and I felt miserable when I entered my room. BTW, there were all sorts of dogs/ K-9 lovers in the elevator. I wish I had known this before. The original room that they gave me at 7:00 p.m. on the day of check-in was not ready. I went to my room to be greeted by housekeeping who were cleaning a bad mess. One of them took the slow elevator back to lobby and got me my keys to a different room. - The room that I got into was very far from elevators and very musty. - The bed was ok but comforters were not thick/plush for a good cozy sleep. - Had to keep the fans on to kill the musty smell but the fans were noisy and too close to the bed. - Some dust/allergens and I kept coughing through out the night. - Only nearby restaurant belongs to hotel --extremely slow service and food is not consistent.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Murison50
Reviews.Content: A Mexican owned and run hotel who can teach the others a lot. This hotel pay great attention to little details. I had asked for a quiet room and that is what I got, although the walls were a bit thin. The string to pull the blinds came out in my hand, but within two minutes of calling reception a very competent repair man fixed it with five mins. It was so easy to hop on the red bus which stops outside and have a ride to Manhattan beach, where you can while away the time people or beach guard watching, go to the free Aquarium at the end of the pier, or stroll in and out of the many boutiques. The red bus offers a day ticket to hop on and off all day, and appears every half an hour, so you can go and enjoy the Malls too! I slept very well, enjoyed the abundance of hot water, and the snacks in the in house Bistro were Mexican and good. You can exercise all your indulgences off in the very clean and comfortably warm pool. I would not hesitate to use this chain of hotels again...

Reviews.Title: “Did not expect a restaurant and front desk people in business attire.”
Reviews.Author: AlextheLion
Reviews.Content: Upon pulling up to the parking garage, my first impression was this La Quinta was a typical, cheap place to stay. But after entering the lobby, my views completely changed. I was greeted by an employee in a business suit, after check in I was handed my room key, I expected a typical credit card style that is used in every other hotel. Instead I received a USB like key, he said this is one of the few hotels that have this system. Next I went to my room, very clean and neat, this is what I expected. I ate in the restaurant, which is the only LQ that is owned and operated by the hotel. Food was expensive, but tasted good. Only down side is that you have to pay $15 for parking. After looking at the website for other hotels I figured it was around the same price at this time for hotels that included free parking, that is why I choose to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it as we had good night sleep that we got over our jet lag”
Reviews.Author: Jennychong
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nicely located The hotel room is clean and spacious The bed is very comfortable The WIFI speed is fast The breakfast is superb

Reviews.Title: “Basic airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: abqtraveler13
Reviews.Content: This is an OK hotel... especially if you have an early morning flight out of LAX. You only get 20 minutes of free parking to check-in and unload your rental car. And although the front desk staff were friendly enough, they chatted amongst themselves throughout the entire check-in process, making those minutes tick by. We only just made it back to the car in the allotted amount of time. The lobby is large, bright, clean and welcoming. You can print your boarding pass, free of charge, on the lobby computer. Basic, good sized rooms with few amenities. The room was basically neat and clean on the surface, but the stains on the upholstery and bed covers were a real turn off. Although the bed was comfortable, the noise from the street below was quite loud throughout the night (10th floor, room 1019). The heating/cooling worked well but could not block out the noise and as a result, we did not have a restful stay. The pool area had been neglected during the day. There were no clean towels available and other travelers had left behind food, clothing and other items strewn about on the tables, chairs, and the ground so we decided against a swim in the pool. It was not an inviting atmosphere. There is a nice breakfast buffet in the morning, but our flight was too early for us to enjoy it. We did grab a cup of coffee from the early-bird set up in the lobby before we jumped on the fast, convenient free shuttle to the airport. We had read in other reviews that the Thrifty Car Rental was just across the street, so we rented from them. It was a quick two block walk back to the hotel after returning the car. I was traveling with someone on a budget and this seemed like a good place after reading other reviewsâ€¦ but I am quite picky, so next time Iâ€™ll look for something more upscale.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is good but, the handicapped parking could be improved.”
Reviews.Author: Saraleemacdonald
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay but they need to add more handicapped parking spaces. We were told that there were more spaces on the upper floors of the parking structure there were not. We had to go back down and park on the ground floor where we originally were.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel at LAX”
Reviews.Author: KHorne
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a very convenient location and is a good place to stay when you have a flight the next morning from LAX. Hotel is clean, quiet (you do not know you are right near an airport) and friendly with a bar and a restaurant. You can turn in your rental car as there is a shuttle to the airport, which is only minutes away. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for an overnight in LA”
Reviews.Author: eyeyore
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after flying from Australia - staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms were very clean. Hotel is easy to get to LAX, you just get on the free shuttle bus and it stop right outside the door. If you just need a hotel for an overnight stay in LA, then I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Grace082
Reviews.Content: Proximity to the airport is great, breakfast was good and even if you had breakfast the last hour, there was enough food. Pleasant and accommodating front desk. Overall, hotel was clean and met our needs thou bathroom was a bit tight. Free printing at the business center

Reviews.Title: “Good for short stay near airport”
Reviews.Author: KeepPeddling
Reviews.Content: Stop over for 4 days to site see and visit family on my way to Hawaii. Adequate service van from and to airport. We rented a car near the hotel and returned it the evening prior to our flight to Hawaii. We were able to walk from the auto rental drop-off barn to the hotel and we took the morning airport shuttle to make our flight. Worked just fine. Room was clean, service god and breakfast adequate. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT FOR OVER NIGHT STOP OVER at LAX”
Reviews.Author: tandylands
Reviews.Content: We were en route from New York to Sydney when our flight got cancelled so we were offered an overnight stay in LA. They allocated us the La Quinta Inn and Suites at LAX. The rooms were clean and very comfortable, and being so close to the airport, there was no noise from overhead aircraft. The breakfast was fantastic and much better than expected, the service desk staff were more than helpful with any assistance that we needed. AS we had a few hours to kill whilst waiting for our connecting flight, we boarded a red shuttle/trolly bus to Manhatten beach. The shuttle bus stop is right at the front of the hotel, and visits a number of attractions, mainly the beach and selected outlet shopping centres. The cost from memory was no more than $10, if not less. It was well worth the cost and provided the perfect short trip away from the hotel whilst awaiting the flight, can highly recommend. Overall the hotel is the perfect option for short stays en route to further destinations.

Reviews.Title: “A terrific option, especially if spending your own money”
Reviews.Author: MoFloChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: Full disclosure: I'm generally a fan of La Quinta, although I'm occasionally disappointed, especially when I find myself in an older hotel that hasn't been renovated in 30 years. They are pet friendly and typically feature very clean comfortable accommodations and friendly service. And they allow me to bring my dog without requiring that I pay extra for him. This hotel is very large and is obviously a reincarnation of what used to be a Holiday Inn or something, but I am more than satisfied. Tour groups were checking in as I arrived, and they were being handled efficiently without unduly delaying the individual traveler (me). Although located just outside the entrance to LAX and I could see the planes landing from my window, I heard no airplane noise. My room was freshly painted, with new carpeting and Ikea'ish furnishings, including an attractive vanity in the bathroom. The bed was as comfortable as most hotel beds and there were plenty of pillows. The towels in the bathroom were new and relatively thick. When I asked for late checkout, it was granted instantly. I didn't go to breakfast. There's a restaurant in the hotel, which is unusual for La Quinta, and even room service (with a very limited, but reasonably priced, menu) between 3 pm and 9 pm. There's a pool and a fitness center (I didn't visit either one). A free shuttle to the airport runs every 15 minutes 24 hours a day, though since it serves multiple properties you probably need to allow extra time for all the loading and unloading involved. There are 3 fast food restaurants on the block, including a 24-hour Subway across the street. The Westin Hotel across the street has a sit-down restaurant, although it does require walking to the end of a long block to cross busy Century Blvd. safely. There's even a bail-bond agency right across the street in case your LA vacation gets a little too wild! My king-bed room, which had a refrigerator and microwave, was well under $100 before taxes and parking, which is $15. Paying for parking is uncommon at LaQuinta, but I've never been to an LAX hotel that has free parking. In this neighborhood you can pay 50%-200% more and get a posher lobby, a slightly bigger room, or a full-service restaurant, but why would you?

Reviews.Title: “Close to LAX and quite comfy....”
Reviews.Author: Bockie
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night, on way to Honolulu and suited our needs perfectly. Staff were friendly and helpful. Got to use the free internet in the lobby to check emails and flights. We ate in the restaurant and although warned by another guest that it was not great, had no other choice. We sat at the bar, had a couple of drinks and ordered a Club Sandwich! Must say one of the nicest I've ever had. Enjoyed our one night - room was comfy and would suggest to others to stay here - we didn't seem to hear any planes at all!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD VALUE, BUT DON'T BE IN A HURRY FOR THEIR SHUTTLE BUS”
Reviews.Author: TRB
Reviews.Content: PROS: Nice large room, standard styrofoam breakfast, friendly staff, close to LAX,good value. CONS: To their credit their shuttle bus is shared with 2 other nearby hotels. This means there is one shuttle bus, not three different ones. This is good for the environment. However, the LaQuinta is the last one to be picked up for the return trip to the airport AND THE BUS IS OFTEN FULL before it gets to the La Quinta. So if you choose this hotel allow an extra 15-30 minutes to get back to the airport if you need to get there at busy times of the day (7-9am especially).

Reviews.Title: “Served the purpose ...”
Reviews.Author: sandlLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: Fine for an overnight near the airport, but couldn't find anywhere to eat nearby except a dismal Tacobel and a shop which sells snacks. Clean, quiet room, everyything worked.

Reviews.Title: “It's All Right”
Reviews.Author: Clamato
Reviews.Content: A great location for an over-night stay to catch an early plane. Thrifty rental car is 1/2 block away; convenient for drop off then walk to hotel. Shuttle service is free and runs all night. Small room but nice and adequate. Comfortable bed. Sound of planes is somewhat muffled by windows but you know you are close to one of the busiest airports. Good free WiFi. Shampoo, coffee, fridge and microwave. Bathroom needs better lighting for shaving and no fan means don't expect to see in mirror after shower. Elevator buttons are on wrong side, left as you enter and not right so I found it frustrating. Did not enjoy food in restaurant. I don't think they have enough restaurant business to hire good chefs and have fresh produce. Eat somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for an overnight stop by LAX”
Reviews.Author: PennyPurples
Reviews.Content: Great location for a stop before or after a flight. Free airport shuttle is great and the driver is helpful with luggage, but it can take a litte whie to get round all the hotels it covers. Parking is easy to use. Reception on arrival was very good, with staff providing all the info we needed without us having to ask. Rooms are a good enough size with comfortable bed, nice linen, everything you need for a good night's stay. Free WiFi is great and was reliable. Breakfast was everything 'packaged' with disposable plates & cultery, quite poor quality food, but for the inclusive price quite adequate. We were happy to stay here and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: ritz0529
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Quinta Inn this past summer while visiting a couple beaches in the LA area and I must say i was pretty impressed with this hotel. You do have a longer drive to local beaches like Santa Monica Beach, Venice Beach, etc but for the price you pay it's worth it. The rooms are clean, great staff and free breakfast (which isn't great but it's free). I definitely plan on staying at a La Quinta Inn in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the price and a quick stop over”
Reviews.Author: Frequent_flyer1989
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great! It's clean and the rooms are big and most importantly it's comfortable especially if you are stopping over in lax. Free breakfast in the morning and free transport to the airport. Have no complaints or worries about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: checo446
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Hotwire. The hotels interior feels a bit dated; however, the room was comfortable and clean but again felt a bit dated. My room did have a mini-fridge, microwave and coffee maker which was nice. Self park in the garage is around $15 a night so you need to factor that into your stay. This is fairly typical of a lot of LA area hotels though. The fitness room on the second floor is adequate for cardio and has 2 treadmills, an elliptical and a stationary bike. Breakfast in the morning was adequate with a selection of eggs, potatoes, muffins, cereal, bread, toast, etc. The location is pretty good convenient to LAX and the 405 directly east. Overall, the hotel was suited for my needs for one night and I got a good night of sleep. I wouldn't be adverse to staying here the next time I come to LA for a short business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly good hotel”
Reviews.Author: equinoxAK
Reviews.Content: If you are in LA for one night and just need a good place to sleep, this is the ticket. The shuttle is free, the bed is comfy, and there's food on the premises. If you want to take a bit of a walk, head out for about a mile down Century Blvd. and you can walk up to Trader Joe's, and next door is a all-you-can-eat buffet. The place was clean, the staff was friendly, and the shampoo fine. I don't need luxury, so this place was great for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: Samer16
Reviews.Content: Highlights: -Exceptional front desk staff -Efficient shuttles and nice drivers -FREE wireless internet -FREE breakfast -Great price Cons: -Slow elevator -No meat at breakfast For a romantic 6 day get-away to LA, I did a lot of checking on hotels and decided to stay at La Quinta LAX - what a great decision! The front staff were exceptionally nice and helpful, in person and on the phone. After reading reviews which commented on the traffic noise, I requested a room away from the road. The room which we received was in the back of the hotel and very, very quiet, perfect for a light sleeper like my boyfriend! It was also clean and had a nice decor. The bed was very comfortable and we slept soundly every night. The free shuttle service to LAX was convenient and the drivers courteous. The front staff also gave us great advice about where to go in Manhattan Beach and made it easy for us to purchase tickets for the Trolley to get there, which conveniently stops right outside the hotel. We did not rent a car, so we did not have to worry about parking. The maid service was unobtrusive and efficient. The only cons were the slow elevator, which isn't really a big deal, and having no meat at breakfast. There was a great variety of muffins, yogurt, cereal etc., but I prefer a heavy breakfast while I'm on vacation, so we just skipped the breakfast at the hotel and went to the Denny's down the street. Even though it doesn't seem to be in a great area, we still felt safe walking down Century Blvd., even very late at night. The bill was exactly correct at the end of the stay and check-out was a breeze. I feel like we received 4-star hotel treatment at a 2-star hotel price! Overall, it was an amazing and relaxing vacation and La Quinta helped make it so wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value except for parking fees”
Reviews.Author: FiveWeeks
Reviews.Content: This hotel is somewhat dated in room fixtures (bath and room key and computer set up, in particular) but it was clean and the beds were really comfortable. The breakfast was good with coffee and muffins available before the full breakfast. The value was exceptional for the area. The parking was $15/day plus taxes but the room rate was too good to pass up. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, good value for overnight at LAX”
Reviews.Author: EasyGoingTraveler77
Reviews.Content: Nice La Quinta property. Room is typical, good quality. Had a minor problem with a closet door, and the maintenance man fixed it within 5 minutes after being called. Breakfast was above average. So convenient to LAX. Nothing much within walking distance in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable traveller's hotel”
Reviews.Author: Baselscot
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights in La Quinta and found it to be a good choice with a comfortable, well equipped room. It's close to LAX with a free shuttle bus but I was never bothered by what aircraft noise there was. The beach was just a couple of short bus rides away and the weather was certainly warm enough to use it. Service and food in the hotel was of the high standard I expect in the USA. It is possible to get to downtown LA by public transport but it's a bit of a trek. But for early morning departures or short stay overs La Quinta has everything you'd need.

Reviews.Title: “The only place I stay while in LA!”
Reviews.Author: tarkus123
Reviews.Content: I travel to LA at least twice a year for business and found this gem in 2008 while in LA for a week long conference. All the hotels that the conference recommended in downtown LA were $200+. I decided to give this La Quinta a try to save some cash (free breakfast to boot). I was pleasantly surprised at the service and cleanliness of this hotel. It's a great location to the airport and the freeway. There's free WIFI in-room, the beds are very comfortable and considering it's proximity to the airport, it's very quiet. The adjacent parking garage is safe a convenient ($12 per day). The breakfast is always fresh and there is a decent variety of pastries, waffles or pancakes, juice, fruit, donuts, etc. The rooms also have a fridge and some have microwaves. I stayed for a week on that first visit in October of 2009. I returned in February of 2010 for 3 days, and again in October of 2010 for another week. It has been consistent. I should also note that I usually arrive later in the evening on my trips to LA (around 10pm or later) and the hotel restaurant closes at 10. However, there is a Denny's just about a block away that's very convenient and open 24 hours. Now for the cons....A minor thing - but something to mention: Elevators... They are VERY slow! The elevator in the parking garage on the first visit was almost useless. However, on the last visit it seemed to run a bit faster. The lobby elevators took so long on this last visit in Oct. 2010, that I rarely used them for the week I was there. Fortunately, I had a room on the second floor so I used the stairs most of the time. All in all - a great value for the money. Clean and comfortable. I'll be staying again in 2 weeks (Feb. 2011) and have made reservations for the Oct. 2011 conference I attend downtown. The money I save staying at this hotel rather than the downtown conference hotels allows me to rent a car and explore LA on off hours.

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ama06
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel it's really nice :) We stayed in this hotel with my housband and our daughter in October 2010 and we stayed very very well, we loved our room because it's very very clean and spacious, even if the bathroom is not so big but it's okay! the bed is very comfy. The hotel is near the airport and the car rentals and it's a great thing after 15 hours in the airplain... and it's a front of a Mc Donald's. The free Breakfast it was amazing with hot and cold buffet! The guys at the front desk was kind with us and offer to our0 little girl a lollipop :) The free internet connection it's okay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: Family_of_four99
Reviews.Content: Visited for the LA Autoshow. Check in was quick, parking was easy and the rooms where good for the price. Don't expect luxury for the price. I think the rates are fair for what you get. Breakfast is always nice. Would stay again if I needed to be a close to the airport and all I needed was to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, fair priced place for pet owners”
Reviews.Author: marmot1995
Reviews.Content: This was my first LA trip with a dog in tow. I normally stay at the LAX Westin across the street because priceline often has great deals. But pets are $50 a night there. Right across the street is La Quinta LAX which has slightly cheaper parking, a great free breakfast (eggs, potatoes, toast, fruit, cereal, pastries), super clean rooms, and they don't charge for pets. Had a king room. No flat screen tv but that was fine with me. Thermostat worked very well. Super clean room and bathroom. Staff was brisk and not super friendly, but they were efficient and definitely made themselves available to answer questions. Could hear people coming and going in the hallways, but this seems pretty standard for hotels. Wifi was free and seemed to work well throughout the day and evening. I noticed numerous security guards in the lobby as well as on the floors. I never felt like I needed them around, but nonetheless it's always nice to have extra security around. This is an airport hotel so the area is ok but not great. It is on a major street but from my perspective this made it convenient....though not necessarily for walking. There is a taco bell and mcdonalds on either side of the hotel. This hotel exceeded my expectations given the fair price (for the area). I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable beds, free wifi, free airport shuttle”
Reviews.Author: samamy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Quinta for one night before an early morning flight from LAX. The reception were helpful, advising us what time we should meet in reception to take the shuttle to the airport. Unfortunately the shuttle was running a fair bit late but we made it on time, which was fine. The room was spacious with two double beds. We were exhausted so spent most of our stay sleeping peacefully. They offer free breakfast but we weren't able to take advantage of it as we left at 5am and breakfast starts at 6!

Reviews.Title: “If you have a conference at the Westin... STAY HERE INSTEAD !”
Reviews.Author: KarenB_007
Reviews.Content: It is what it is - it isnt the hotel lobby or room of a 5 star but for the price (averaged $71/night) I had all these things that my conference mates at the westin (average $125/night special conference rate) did not... a) fridge b) microwave c) free hot breakfast (coffee, hot and cold cereal, fruit, pastries, pancakes, toast, potatos, eggs, yoghurt, granola etc) d) free wifi internet in my room and in the lobby and e) the 5 min walk to the westin guaranteed me a chance to be outside and get some fresh air and sunshine !

Reviews.Title: “Great, Inexpensive Hotel For LAX Travel”
Reviews.Author: BigdawgChicago
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night on the way back from Hawaii. The rate was $89 a night and was well worth it. Unlike most La Quintas, this is a high rise hotel. The room and bathroom were clean, the bed comfortable and there was a very long desk/work station to work at. TV was flat screen and had a good variety of channels and the free WI FI worked fine. There is a free airport shuttle shared by the Westin and Holiday Inn that runs every 15 minutes and I had no problems with it. The free breakfast buffet was a cut above the other free hotel breakfasts. There was a hot container of scrambled eggs and toast on a par with a nice Marriott style buffet along with the usual items. A previous reviewer complained she had to cross a 4 lane highway to go across the street to get water. She is referring to Century Blvd, a normal big city main street which is not a highway and which people cross routinely. For the rate charged along with free shuttle, free WI FI and free breakfast buffet, there cannot be a better place to stay if you staying for one night for an LAX flight.

Reviews.Title: “Not for me”
Reviews.Author: marniemac
Reviews.Content: Qantas put us up here after the A380 grounding. Shame on them. What a dump. Rooms were clean but the beds were awful. As we didn't have our luggage I was forced to use the toiletries provided by the hotel - the shampoo was like paint stripper. There was no water in any of the vending machines (sold out) so was forced to cross the multi lane highway at 4am by myself in a really crappy area to get water. Not great as a lone female. I assume this place is cheap. It would want to be. Didn't eat in the restaurant as it was too depressing. Breakfast was served on styrofoam plates.... I think that says it all. Only pro was free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: catwoman00
Reviews.Content: The a/c went on as soon as I walked in - yay, since it was hot, but it smelled moldy and made me start to sneeze. Yuck. Bathroom door wouldn't close - warped. No hand towels were provided - I only had one washcloth and two bath towels - strange. Linens were clean, but the bed faced the a/c unit so everytime it went on, you get hit with a blast of air. The water was only lukewarm - I took a shower at 8 pm but didn't even have to mix any cold water in.
